DataElement.preferredName: Patient Interstitial Disease Lung Personal Medical History Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether the patient/participant has interstitial lung disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Interstitial Disease Lung Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the personal medical history (an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced) of interstitial lung (the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place) disease (a disease occurring chiefly in the connective-tissue framework of an organ).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Interstitial Disease Lung Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: A disease occurring chiefly in the connective-tissue framework of an organ:One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A disease occurring chiefly in the connective-tissue framework of an organ.

One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a history o
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a current or a history of interstitial lung disease, known severely impaired lung function (spirometry and DLCO 50% or less of normal and O2 saturation 88% or less at rest on room air) or non-infectious pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have interstitial lung disease that is symptomatic or may interfere with the detection or management of suspected drug-related pulmonary toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have prior history of pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a past medical history of interstitial lung disease, drug-induced interstitial lung disease, radiation pneumonitis requiring steroid treatment, or any evidence of clinically active interstitial lung disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has been assigned to receive everolimus or Trametinib DMSO, does patient have a current or a history of interstitial lung disease, known severely impaired lung function (spirometry and DLCO 50% or less of normal and O2 saturation 88% or less at rest on room air) or non-infectious pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant lung disease including known history or evidence of interstitial lung disease or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) that requires oxygen therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of pneumonitis attributed to an EGFR inhibitor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of interstitial lung disease (IDL)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active non-infectious pneumonitis greater than or equal to Grade 2 or history of Grade 3 non-infectious pneumonitis requiring steroids within the past 12 months; or any history of Grade 4 non-infectious pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known and confirmed diagnosis of interstitial lung disease (IDL)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have interstitial lung disease that is symptomatic or may interfere with the detection or management of suspected drug-related pulmonary toxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, pneumonitis (including drug induced), organizing pneumonia (i.e., bronchiolitis obliterans, cryptogenic organizing pneumonia, etc.), or evidence of active pneumonitis on screening chest computed tomography (CT) scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known or confirmed history of pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis requiring supplemental oxygen or treatment with oral or intravenously administered corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of interstitial lung disease or pneumonitis or pneumonitis requiring supplemental oxygen or treatment with oral or intravenously administered corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of clinically significant interstitial lung disease (ILD) (including drug-induced ILD), radiation pneumonitis requiring steroid treatment, or any evidence of clinically active ILD?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a past medical history of interstitial lung disease, drug-induced interstitial lung disease, radiation pneumonitis which required steroid treatment, or any evidence of clinically active interstitial lung disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active interstitial lung disease (ILD)/pneumonitis or a prior history of ILD/pneumonitis requiring treatment with steroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of or concurrent interstitial lung disease of any severity and/or severely impaired lung function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of clinically significant interstitial lung disease, drug-induced interstitial lung disease, radiation pneumonitis which required steroid treatment, or any evidence of clinically active interstitial lung disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active (non-infectious) pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have symptomatic interstitial lung disease, pneumonitis, known pulmonary fibrosis or a history of interstitial lung disease of any severity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of concurrent condition of interstitial lung disease of any severity and/or severely impaired lung function (as judged by the investigator)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known moderate to severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, interstitial lung disease, and pulmonary fibrosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known moderate to severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, interstitial lung disease and pulmonary fibrosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of, or currently active (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids, unless there is a prior history of chemotherapy or radiotherapy induced pneumonitis meeting the eligibility inclusion criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of or concurrent condition of interstitial lung disease of any severity and/or severely impaired lung function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of (non-infectious) interstitial lung disease (ILD) /pneumonitis that required steroids, current ILD/pneumonitis, or for whom suspected ILD/pneumonitis cannot be ruled out by imaging at screening?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of or any evidence of active non-infectious pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have suspected or history of interstitial lung disease (ILD)/pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of (non-infectious) ILD/pneumonitis that required steroids, have current ILD/pneumonitis, or where suspected ILD/pneumonitis cannot be ruled out by imaging at screening?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids or current pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids or has a current diagnosis of pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have pneumonitis, interstitial lung disease, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, cystic fibrosis, Aspergillosis, active tuberculosis, or history of opportunistic infections (pneumocystis pneumonia or cytomegalovirus pneumonia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known history of (non-infectious) pneumonitis that required steroids or has current non-infectious pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have severe obstructive pulmonary disease or interstitial lung disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have lung disease causing dyspnea at rest?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 10.23.2023 Added AQT per ticket request CADSR0002989 _mmt
